event.title: Last summer, a crypto outbreak scared

data.event: Last summer, a crypto outbreak scared plenty of people away from public pools and water parks across North Texas.

event.title: Last year, 476 cases of crypto were reported

data.event: Last year, 476 cases of crypto were reported throughout Tarrant County.
In July, crypto was discovered in the water of Burger’s Lake in west Fort Worth; a swimmer was identified as the source of the infection.
Last year in Texas there were 1,981 confirmed cases, up from 233 in 2007, according to the Texas Department of State Health Services.
Six Flags Hurricane Harbor, which had no crypto cases last year, is among several facilities planning to hyperchlorinate its pools.

Keller has considered a UV system but for now will focus on educating the public about healthy swimming habits and following the public health department’s recommendations, said Dona Roth Kinney, director of parks and recreation.

data.event: The bottom line is that it’s up to people to prevent an outbreak by avoiding public pools for 10 days if they have had gastrointestinal symptoms, Jefferson said.
